books.name: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: To Kill a Mockingbird was published in 1960 and became an immediate classic of literature. The novel examines racism in the American South through the innocent wide eyes of a clever young girl named Jean Louise (“Scout”) Finch.

books.name: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: The Great Gatsby provides an insider’s look into the Jazz Age of the 1920s in United States history while at the same time critiquing the idea of the American Dream.

books.name: One Hundred Years of Solitude
books.author: Gabriel García Márquez
books.description: The novel tells the story of seven generations of the Buendía family and follows the establishment of their town Macondo until its destruction along with the last of the family’s descendents.

books.name: A Passage to India
books.author: E.M. Forster
books.description: The novel tells the story of seven generations of the Buendía family and follows the establishment of their town Macondo until its destruction along with the last of the family’s descendents.

books.name: Invisible Man
books.author: Ralph Ellison
books.description: The novel tells the story of seven generations of the Buendía family and follows the establishment of their town Macondo until its destruction along with the last of the family’s descendents.

books.name: Neon In Daylight
books.author: Hermione Hoby
books.description: The debut novel from Guardian and New Yorker writer Hermione Hoby finds native Brit Kate in heatwave-struck New York where she meets two strangers, Bill and Inez, who she falls for in different ways and who pull her into the frantic rhythm of the city.

books.name: The Mermaid and Mrs Hancock
books.author: Imogen Hermes Gower
books.description: Gossip spreads through the docks of Georgian London when a merchant's ship is traded for a mermaid. But their new-found popularity leads to an encounter that will doom his dazzling prize.

books.name: Asymmetry
books.author: Lisa Halliday
books.description: Asymmetry draws together two improbably linked stories: a young woman who starts an affair with a famous writer in New York and an Iraqi-American who is detained at Heathrow airport.

books.name: Red Clocks
books.author: Leni Zumas
books.description: Set in an imagined future America were abortion is illegal, IVF is banned and new legislation grants rights to every new embryo, five women suffer the consequences of the new world order with one put on trial in a crazed witch-hunt.
